cache_inode_setattr.c

00087 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00088 #include "config.h"
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 
00092 #include "LRU_List.h"
00093 #include "log_functions.h"
00094 #include "HashData.h"
00095 #include "HashTable.h"
00096 #include "fsal.h"
00097 #include "cache_inode.h"
00098 #include "stuff_alloc.h"
00099 
00100 #include <unistd.h>
00101 #include <sys/types.h>
00102 #include <sys/param.h>
00103 #include <time.h>
00104 #include <pthread.h>
00105  
00124 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_setattr( cache_entry_t        * pentry, 
00125                                           fsal_attrib_list_t   * pattr, 
00126                                           hash_table_t         * ht, /* Unused, kept for protototype's homogeneity */
00127                                           cache_inode_client_t * pclient, 
00128                                           fsal_op_context_t    * pcontext, 
00129                                           cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00130 {
00131   fsal_handle_t      * pfsal_handle ;
00132   fsal_status_t        fsal_status ;
00133   fsal_attrib_list_t * p_object_attributes ;
00134   fsal_attrib_list_t   result_attributes ;
00135   int                  do_trunc = 0 ;
00136   
00137   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00138   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00139 
00140   /* stat */
00141   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00142   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_SETATTR] += 1 ;
00143 
00144   /* Lock the entry */
00145   P( pentry->lock ) ;
00146   
00147   switch( pentry->internal_md.type )
00148     {
00149     case REGULAR_FILE:
00150       pfsal_handle = &pentry->object.file.handle ;
00151       break ;
00152       
00153     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00154       pfsal_handle  = &pentry->object.symlink.handle ;
00155       break ;
00156       
00157     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00158       pfsal_handle = &pentry->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00159       break ;
00160 
00161     case DIR_CONTINUE:
00162       /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
00163        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
00164       P( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00165       pfsal_handle =  &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00166       V( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00167       break ;
00168       
00169     case CHARACTER_FILE:
00170     case BLOCK_FILE:
00171     case SOCKET_FILE:
00172     case FIFO_FILE:
00173       pfsal_handle = &pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
00174       break ;      
00175     }
00176   
00177   /* Call FSAL to set the attributes */
00178   /* result_attributes.asked_attributes = pattr->asked_attributes ;*/
00179     
00180   /* mod Th.Leibovici on 2006/02/13
00181    * We ask back all standard attributes, in case they have been modified
00182    * by another program (pftp, rcpd...)
00183    */
00184   result_attributes.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask;
00185   /* end of mod */
00186 
00187   fsal_status = FSAL_setattrs( pfsal_handle, pcontext, pattr, &result_attributes ) ;
00188   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00189     {
00190       *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00191       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00192       
00193       /* stat */
00194       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_SETATTR] += 1 ;
00195 
00196       if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) 
00197         {
00198           cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00199 
00200           DisplayLog( "cache_inode_setattr: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00201 
00202           if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00203                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_setattr: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00204 
00205           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00206         }
00207 
00208       return *pstatus ;
00209     }
00210 
00211   /* Keep the new attribute in cache */
00212   switch( pentry->internal_md.type )
00213     {
00214     case REGULAR_FILE:
00215       p_object_attributes = &(pentry->object.file.attributes) ;
00216       break ;
00217       
00218     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00219       p_object_attributes = &(pentry->object.symlink.attributes) ;
00220       break ;
00221       
00222     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00223       p_object_attributes = &(pentry->object.dir_begin.attributes) ;
00224       break ;
00225       
00226     case DIR_CONTINUE:
00227       /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
00228        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
00229       P( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00230       p_object_attributes = &(pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes) ;
00231       V( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00232       break ;
00233       
00234     case CHARACTER_FILE:
00235     case BLOCK_FILE:
00236     case SOCKET_FILE:
00237     case FIFO_FILE:      
00238       p_object_attributes = &(pentry->object.special_obj.attributes) ;
00239       break ;      
00240       
00241     }
00242   
00243   /* Update the cached attributes */
00244   if( ( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ) ||
00245       ( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED) )
00246     {
00247 
00248       if( pentry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE )
00249       {
00250         if( pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
00251         {
00252           /* Operation on a non data cached file */
00253           p_object_attributes->filesize  = result_attributes.filesize ;
00254           p_object_attributes->spaceused = result_attributes.filesize ; /* Unclear hook here. BUGAZOMEU */
00255         }
00256         else
00257         {
00258           /* Data cached file */
00259           /* Do not set the p_object_attributes->filesize and p_object_attributes->spaceused  in this case 
00260                * This will lead to a situation where (for example) untar-ing a file will produced invalid files 
00261            * with a size of 0 despite the fact that they are not empty */
00262 #ifdef  _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00263           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_setattr with FSAL_ATTR_SIZE on data cached entry" ) ;
00264 #endif
00265         }
00266       }
00267       else if ( pattr->asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_SIZE )
00268         DisplayLog( "WARNING !!! cache_inode_setattr tryed to operate size on a non REGULAR_FILE type=%d", pentry->internal_md.type ) ;
00269     }
00270   
00271       
00272   if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & (FSAL_ATTR_MODE|FSAL_ATTR_OWNER|FSAL_ATTR_GROUP) )
00273     {
00274       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_MODE )
00275         p_object_attributes->mode = result_attributes.mode ;
00276       
00277       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_OWNER )
00278         p_object_attributes->owner = result_attributes.owner ;
00279       
00280       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_GROUP )
00281         p_object_attributes->group = result_attributes.group ;
00282     }
00283   
00284   if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & (FSAL_ATTR_ATIME|FSAL_ATTR_CTIME|FSAL_ATTR_MTIME) )
00285     {
00286       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_ATIME )
00287         p_object_attributes->atime = result_attributes.atime ;
00288       
00289       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_CTIME )
00290         p_object_attributes->ctime = result_attributes.ctime ;
00291 
00292       if( result_attributes.asked_attributes & FSAL_ATTR_MTIME )
00293         p_object_attributes->mtime = result_attributes.mtime ;
00294     }
00295   
00296  /* Return the attributes as set */
00297   *pattr = *p_object_attributes ; 
00298 
00299   /* validate the entry */
00300   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;  
00301 
00302   /* Release the entry */
00303   V( pentry->lock ) ;
00304 
00305   /* stat */
00306    if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00307      pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_SETATTR] += 1 ;
00308    else
00309      pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_SETATTR] += 1 ;
00310 
00311   return *pstatus ;
00312 } /* cache_inode_setattr */
